content.user_title: Generate Code Review Digest from PR Comments
content.value_statement: Code review feedback is scattered across many PRs and hard to track. This skill transforms PR review comments into a structured markdown digest that captures themes, repeated issues, and actionable best practices for your team.
actual_capabilities: Fetches PR review comments using GitHub CLI (gh)
Clusters review feedback into thematic categories
Detects repeated issues across digests with [NEW] and [REPEAT] tags
Writes structured markdown files to docs/review-digests/
Follows project-specific AGENTS.md guidelines when present
Creates reference-style links to specific PRs and comments
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Only generates digests within docs/review-digests/ directory
Cannot access PR data without gh or without appropriate GitHub permissions
Excludes bot and infrastructure comments with no review content

use_cases.title: Track Code Quality Trends
use_cases.description: Identify recurring code issues and best practices across your team's PR reviews over time.

use_cases.title: Team Learning Summaries
use_cases.description: Generate markdown digests that document what the team is learning from code review feedback.

use_cases.title: Documentation Automation
use_cases.description: Create persistent records of code review themes for onboarding and standards documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Digest
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate a weekly code review digest
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a code review digest for this repo for 2025-02-01 ‚Üí 2025-02-14.

prompt_templates.title: With Historical Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a weekly PR review digest for 2025-03-10 ‚Üí 2025-03-17, using any existing digests as historical context.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-Repo Analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyze reviews in a specific repository
prompt_templates.prompt: From 2025-04-01 to 2025-04-30, summarize what reviewers focused on in owner/service-repo and highlight repeated issues.

prompt_templates.title: Themed Newsletter
prompt_templates.scenario: Create styled digest with theme tags
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a newsletter-style code review digest for this project for 2025-05-15 ‚Üí 2025-05-29, tagging themes as [NEW] or [REPEAT].

output_examples.input: Generate a code review digest for this repo for 2025-06-01 ‚Üí 2025-06-15.
output: Main themes: Error handling patterns, test fixture reuse, security review checklist

best_practices: Always specify both start and end dates in YYYY-MM-DD format for clear scope definition.
Review past digests before generating new ones to identify repeated patterns effectively.
Use [NEW] and [REPEAT] tags consistently to help your team track improvement over time.
anti_patterns: Asking for a digest without specifying date boundaries creates ambiguous scope.
Ignoring previous digest history misses opportunities to identify recurring issues.
Skipping [NEW] and [REPEAT] tags reduces the digest value for tracking team learning.

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and OpenAI Codex. Installation and invocation vary by platform.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: It reads PR review comments via GitHub CLI. No local code is accessed. All processing happens locally.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. The skill scope is strictly limited to docs/review-digests/ directory. Application code is never modified.

faq.question: What if gh CLI is not available?
faq.answer: The skill gracefully falls back to summarizing based on locally available notes and clearly marks the digest as partial.

faq.question: Where are digests saved?
faq.answer: Digests are saved to docs/review-digests/YYYY-MM-DD.md. The directory is created if it does not exist.

faq.question: How are repeated issues detected?
faq.answer: The skill compares current themes against the last 3‚Äì4 digests and labels recurring patterns as [REPEAT].
